snippet: More than 800 heavily armed Australian police officers conducted antiterrorism raids in Sydney and Brisbane early on Thursday, and at least 15 people were detained, the police said.
abstract: Australian police conduct antiterrorism raids in Sydney and Brisbane, detaining at least 15 people; Prime Min Tony Abbott says intelligence shows militants connected with Islamic State were planning to abduct and behead a random person in Australia.
lead_paragraph: More than 800 heavily armed Australian police officers conducted antiterrorism raids in Sydney and Brisbane early on Thursday, and at least 15 people were detained, the police said.

headline.main: Australia: Sweeping Raids Seek People Planning Terrorist Attacks
headline.print_headline: Premier Says Militants Planned Beheading in Sydney

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
